instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
It was drinks damaged.After connected power orange light buy not turn on.Sometimes it turn on and
few minuites later turn off again.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.58v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.5v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.5v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> = 16.6v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 16.6v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.42v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.32v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.32v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> = 0 v???

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0v
Any help please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
Any pulse at the big coils?
Check if any <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SX_L</SIGNAL> signal pulses triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Check for corrosion around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
SMC bypass mode start it for few seconds and stop fan spinning.
yes, Pulse at the big coils.
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> signal pulses triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> ,Yes pulse is ther for short period.
corrosion around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.Yes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
Solve any problem generated by corrosion.
Rebuild traces, check all resistors, solders...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B orange light but not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
i found the short at p2 of L7430 and no short at <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, it looks like <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> is  short , so dont know 
how to figure out.
